title: How to Make Mushroom Barley Soup

steps.headline: Chop the vegetables.
steps.description: Wash 1 pound (480 g) of mushrooms, 2 large carrots, 2 large celery stalks, and peel 1 onion. Use a sharp knife to carefully cut the mushrooms into 1/2-inch (12 mm) pieces. You can trim the carrots, celery, onion and then chop them into bite-sized pieces. Don't worry about keeping the chopped vegetables separate. You'll be sauteing them together.

steps.headline: Saute the vegetables and pearl barley.
steps.description: Put 1/4 cup (28 g) of butter into a Dutch oven or soup pot and turn the heat to medium-high. Rinse 1/2 cup (100 g) of pearl barley and add it to the pot along with all of the chopped vegetables. Saute the vegetables for about 20 minutes, so they start to turn golden brown. Remember to stir the mixture frequently to prevent it sticking to the pot.

steps.headline: Stir in the flour and broth.
steps.description: Add 2 tablespoons of all-purpose flour and stir the vegetables well, so they absorb the flour. Slowly whisk in 8 cups (1.89 liters) of vegetable broth. Whisking will prevent lumps from forming. You could also use chicken broth or stock.

steps.headline: Simmer the soup.
steps.description: Keep cooking and stirring the soup, so it comes to a boil. Turn the heat down to medium and let it bubble gently. Simmer the soup with the lid off of the pot for about 40 minutes. Remember to stir it every once in a while. The barley should become tender and the soup will thicken a bit.

steps.headline: Season and serve the simple mushroom barley soup.
steps.description: Chop 1/4 cup (5 g) of fresh parsley and 1 tablespoon of fresh dill. Add the herbs to the soup along with salt and pepper to taste. Serve the soup with your favorite crusty bread. If you don't have fresh dill, you can use 1 teaspoon of dried dill weed.

methods.name: Making Cream of Mushroom and Barley Soup

steps.headline: Cook the pearl barley in broth.
steps.description: Measure 1/2 cup (100 g) of pearl barley into a small saucepan. Pour in 1 1/2 cups (355 ml) of the reduced-sodium chicken or mushroom broth and turn the heat to high, so the liquid boils. Turn the heat to low and put the lid on the pot. Simmer the barley for 30 to 35 minutes. The pearl barley should become tender and the liquid should cook out.

steps.headline: Soak and drain the dried porcini mushrooms.
steps.description: Boil 2 cups (473 ml) of water to boil and pour it into a bowl with 1 ounce (28 g) of dried porcini mushrooms. Let the mushrooms soak for about 20 minutes, so they become soft. To drain the mushrooms, set a mesh strainer over a bowl and lay paper towels in the strainer. Pour the softened mushrooms into the strainer, so the liquid strains into the bowl. You'll want to keep the liquid and add it to the soup later.

steps.headline: Saute the shallots and white mushrooms.
steps.description: Melt 2 teaspoons of butter with 1 tablespoon of extra-virgin olive oil in a Dutch oven or soup pot. Turn the heat to medium-high and mince 4 medium shallots. You should get 1 cup of minced shallots. Add the shallots and saute them for 2 minutes. Stir in 8 cups (20 ounces or 600 g) of sliced white mushrooms. Continue sauteing the mushrooms and shallots for 8 to 10 minutes. The mushrooms will release liquid and then begin to turn brown.

steps.headline: Chop and add the 'porcinis' (mushroom), celery, and seasonings.
steps.description: While the sliced mushrooms and shallot are sauteing, you can finely chop the softened porcini mushrooms. You'll also need to finely chop 2 stalks of celery. Add the porcini mushrooms, celery, 1 tablespoon of minced fresh sage, 1/2 teaspoon of salt, and 1/2 teaspoon of freshly ground pepper to the soup pot. Continue to cook the soup over medium-high heat. If you don't have fresh sage, you can use 1 teaspoon of dried sage.

steps.headline: Stir in the flour and dry sherry.
steps.description: Stir 2 tablespoons of all-purpose flour into the vegetable mixture and cook it for 1 minute. The flour should coat the vegetables. Slowly stir in 1 cup (236 ml) of dry sherry. Most of the sherry will cook off quickly and the remaining liquid in the pot will be thick.

steps.headline: Add and simmer the rest of the broth and soaking liquid.
steps.description: Pour in the soaking liquid that you saved and add the rest of the broth (3 cups or 709 ml). Turn the heat up to high, so the soup begins to bubble vigorously. Turn the heat back down to medium, so it bubbles gently. Simmer the soup with the lid off for 15 to 20 minutes. You'll need to stir the soup occasionally to keep it from sticking. The soup should become thick.

steps.headline: Stir in the cooked barley and sour cream.
steps.description: Add the cooked barley to the soup pot and let the mushroom barley soup cook for another 5 minutes. Turn off the heat and stir in ½ cup (115 g) of reduced-fat sour cream. You can top the soup with ¼ cup (10 g) of minced fresh chives right before you serve it. Avoid cooking the soup after you've added the sour cream. The sour cream could separate.

methods.name: Making Creamy Vegan Mushroom Barley Soup

steps.headline: Soak the cashews.
steps.description: Place 1/2 cup (75 g) of raw cashews into a prep bowl and pour enough water over them to cover the nuts completely. Let the cashews soak in the water for 4 to 8 hours. When you're ready to make the soup, drain the nuts, which should be softened. You can discard the soaking liquid.

steps.headline: Chop and saute the mushrooms.
steps.description: Chop 1 pound (480 g) of assorted fresh mushrooms. Pour 1/4 cup (60 ml) of olive oil into a Dutch oven or soup pot and turn the heat on to medium. Add the chopped mushrooms and saute them for about 8 to 10 minutes. Stir the mushrooms occasionally, so they begin to soften and turn brown. You can use a mix of your favorite mushrooms. For example, try white button, cremini, and shiitake.

steps.headline: Chop and saute the remaining vegetables.
steps.description:
While the mushrooms are sauteing, chop the other vegetables and then add them to the soup pot. Saute the mixture for about 5 minutes, so the vegetables soften. You'll need to dice and add:
1 medium onion,
2 medium carrots
2 celery ribs
4 garlic cloves, minced

steps.headline: Add and simmer wine and thyme.
steps.description: Stir 1 cup (236 ml) of dry white wine into the pot along with 1 teaspoon of dried thyme. Turn the heat up to medium-high, so the soup begins to bubble gently. Continue to adjust the heat, so the soup keeps simmering. Simmer the soup with the lid off for about 5 minutes. Simmering will help the soup reduce and thicken. About half of the liquid in the pot should evaporate as it cooks.

steps.headline: Add and simmer the broth and barley.
steps.description: Add 5 cups (1.18 liters) of the broth to the pot along with 1/2 cup (100 g) of pearl barley. Turn the heat up to high, so the soup begins to boil. Turn the heat back down, so it bubbles gently. Simmer the soup with the lid off for about 45 minutes. The pearl barley should become tender once it's finished cooking.

steps.headline: Blend some of the soup with broth and the soaked cashews.
steps.description: Place the soaked cashews in a blender. Scoop 1 cup of the soup out of the pot and add it to the blender along with the remaining 1 cup (236 ml) of broth. Put the lid on the blender and blitz the mixture until it's smooth. Blending the cashews will give a creamy taste to the soup without adding any dairy.

steps.headline: Pour the cashew mixture, soy sauce, and miso into the soup.
steps.description: Pour the blended cashew mixture into the soup pot and add 1 1/2 tablespoons of soy sauce. If you want to add the white miso paste, stir in 1 1/2 teaspoons of it, so it completely dissolves. Taste the soup and add salt and pepper to taste before you serve it. If the soup is too thick for your liking, you can pour in a little water to thin it out.

steps.headline: Finished.

text:
Making Simple Mushroom Barley Soup Chop the vegetables. Wash 1 pound (480 g) of mushrooms, 2 large carrots, 2 large celery stalks, and peel 1 onion. Use a sharp knife to carefully cut the mushrooms into 1/2-inch (12 mm) pieces. You can trim the carrots, celery, onion and then chop them into bite-sized pieces. Don't worry about keeping the chopped vegetables separate. You'll be sauteing them together. Saute the vegetables and pearl barley. Put 1/4 cup (28 g) of butter into a Dutch oven or soup pot and turn the heat to medium-high. Rinse 1/2 cup (100 g) of pearl barley and add it to the pot along with all of the chopped vegetables. Saute the vegetables for about 20 minutes, so they start to turn golden brown. Remember to stir the mixture frequently to prevent it sticking to the pot. Stir in the flour and broth. Add 2 tablespoons of all-purpose flour and stir the vegetables well, so they absorb the flour. Slowly whisk in 8 cups (1.89 liters) of vegetable broth. Whisking will prevent lumps from forming. You could also use chicken broth or stock. Simmer the soup. Keep cooking and stirring the soup, so it comes to a boil. Turn the heat down to medium and let it bubble gently. Simmer the soup with the lid off of the pot for about 40 minutes. Remember to stir it every once in a while. The barley should become tender and the soup will thicken a bit. Season and serve the simple mushroom barley soup. Chop 1/4 cup (5 g) of fresh parsley and 1 tablespoon of fresh dill. Add the herbs to the soup along with salt and pepper to taste. Serve the soup with your favorite crusty bread. If you don't have fresh dill, you can use 1 teaspoon of dried dill weed. Making Cream of Mushroom and Barley Soup Cook the pearl barley in broth. Measure 1/2 cup (100 g) of pearl barley into a small saucepan. Pour in 1 1/2 cups (355 ml) of the reduced-sodium chicken or mushroom broth and turn the heat to high, so the liquid boils. Turn the heat to low and put the lid on the pot. Simmer the barley for 30 to 35 minutes. The pearl barley should become tender and the liquid should cook out. Soak and drain the dried porcini mushrooms. Boil 2 cups (473 ml) of water to boil and pour it into a bowl with 1 ounce (28 g) of dried porcini mushrooms. Let the mushrooms soak for about 20 minutes, so they become soft. To drain the mushrooms, set a mesh strainer over a bowl and lay paper towels in the strainer. Pour the softened mushrooms into the strainer, so the liquid strains into the bowl. You'll want to keep the liquid and add it to the soup later. Saute the shallots and white mushrooms. Melt 2 teaspoons of butter with 1 tablespoon of extra-virgin olive oil in a Dutch oven or soup pot. Turn the heat to medium-high and mince 4 medium shallots. You should get 1 cup of minced shallots. Add the shallots and saute them for 2 minutes. Stir in 8 cups (20 ounces or 600 g) of sliced white mushrooms. Continue sauteing the mushrooms and shallots for 8 to 10 minutes. The mushrooms will release liquid and then begin to turn brown. Chop and add the 'porcinis' (mushroom), celery, and seasonings. While the sliced mushrooms and shallot are sauteing, you can finely chop the softened porcini mushrooms. You'll also need to finely chop 2 stalks of celery. Add the porcini mushrooms, celery, 1 tablespoon of minced fresh sage, 1/2 teaspoon of salt, and 1/2 teaspoon of freshly ground pepper to the soup pot. Continue to cook the soup over medium-high heat. If you don't have fresh sage, you can use 1 teaspoon of dried sage. Stir in the flour and dry sherry. Stir 2 tablespoons of all-purpose flour into the vegetable mixture and cook it for 1 minute. The flour should coat the vegetables. Slowly stir in 1 cup (236 ml) of dry sherry. Most of the sherry will cook off quickly and the remaining liquid in the pot will be thick. Add and simmer the rest of the broth and soaking liquid. Pour in the soaking liquid that you saved and add the rest of the broth (3 cups or 709 ml). Turn the heat up to high, so the soup begins to bubble vigorously. Turn the heat back down to medium, so it bubbles gently. Simmer the soup with the lid off for 15 to 20 minutes. You'll need to stir the soup occasionally to keep it from sticking. The soup should become thick. Stir in the cooked barley and sour cream. Add the cooked barley to the soup pot and let the mushroom barley soup cook for another 5 minutes. Turn off the heat and stir in ½ cup (115 g) of reduced-fat sour cream. You can top the soup with ¼ cup (10 g) of minced fresh chives right before you serve it. Avoid cooking the soup after you've added the sour cream. The sour cream could separate. Making Creamy Vegan Mushroom Barley Soup Soak the cashews. Place 1/2 cup (75 g) of raw cashews into a prep bowl and pour enough water over them to cover the nuts completely. Let the cashews soak in the water for 4 to 8 hours. When you're ready to make the soup, drain the nuts, which should be softened. You can discard the soaking liquid. Chop and saute the mushrooms. Chop 1 pound (480 g) of assorted fresh mushrooms. Pour 1/4 cup (60 ml) of olive oil into a Dutch oven or soup pot and turn the heat on to medium. Add the chopped mushrooms and saute them for about 8 to 10 minutes. Stir the mushrooms occasionally, so they begin to soften and turn brown. You can use a mix of your favorite mushrooms. For example, try white button, cremini, and shiitake. Chop and saute the remaining vegetables. While the mushrooms are sauteing, chop the other vegetables and then add them to the soup pot. Saute the mixture for about 5 minutes, so the vegetables soften. You'll need to dice and add:
1 medium onion,
2 medium carrots
2 celery ribs
4 garlic cloves, minced Add and simmer wine and thyme. Stir 1 cup (236 ml) of dry white wine into the pot along with 1 teaspoon of dried thyme. Turn the heat up to medium-high, so the soup begins to bubble gently. Continue to adjust the heat, so the soup keeps simmering. Simmer the soup with the lid off for about 5 minutes. Simmering will help the soup reduce and thicken. About half of the liquid in the pot should evaporate as it cooks. Add and simmer the broth and barley. Add 5 cups (1.18 liters) of the broth to the pot along with 1/2 cup (100 g) of pearl barley. Turn the heat up to high, so the soup begins to boil. Turn the heat back down, so it bubbles gently. Simmer the soup with the lid off for about 45 minutes. The pearl barley should become tender once it's finished cooking. Blend some of the soup with broth and the soaked cashews. Place the soaked cashews in a blender. Scoop 1 cup of the soup out of the pot and add it to the blender along with the remaining 1 cup (236 ml) of broth. Put the lid on the blender and blitz the mixture until it's smooth. Blending the cashews will give a creamy taste to the soup without adding any dairy. Pour the cashew mixture, soy sauce, and miso into the soup. Pour the blended cashew mixture into the soup pot and add 1 1/2 tablespoons of soy sauce. If you want to add the white miso paste, stir in 1 1/2 teaspoons of it, so it completely dissolves. Taste the soup and add salt and pepper to taste before you serve it. If the soup is too thick for your liking, you can pour in a little water to thin it out. Finished.
tyn_model: cream of mushroom and barley soup
